column1: Stung Treng City (Khmer: ទីក្រុងស្ទឹងត្រែង) (Lao: ຊຽງແຕງ pronounced [t͡ɕʰīaŋ təŋ]) is the capital of Stung Treng Province
column2: Cambodia. It is the major city (and capital) of both the district and province.

column1: Stung Treng is located on the  Sesan River near its confluence with the Mekong River. It's 376 km from Phnom Penh and it's 5km south of the Laos border.
The river port of the city park is fairly busy
column2: handling trade between Cambodia and Laos and transporting people. The city also lies along the National Highway 7. It has two main bridges
column3: the Stung Treng Bridge on the Mekong and the Sekong Bridge on the Sekong river. The city is served by Stung Treng Airport
column5: there are no regular commercial services.
